Directions
For the Vinaigrette:
Whisk together ingredients for the vinaigrette in a small bowl, seasoning generously with salt and pepper. Reserve.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
For the Salad:
Place farro and water in a medium saucepan with onion, garlic, carrot, and 2 teaspoons salt and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, partially cover, and simmer until farro is just tender, about 20 minutes (see notes). Drain, discard onion, garlic, and carrot and transfer to a bowl to cool.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Gently fold remaining salad ingredients into cooled farro. Add vinaigrette, starting with a few tablespoons at a time. Taste, season with salt and pepper, and add additional vinaigrette as needed. Serve immediately.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Notes
Be careful not to overcook the farro. You want it to stand up to the vinaigrette, so remove it from the heat just when it loses its bite.
Make-Ahead and Storage
You can cook the farro ahead of time and refrigerate it. However, it's best to dress the salad shortly before serving it, ideally at room temperature.
